file_content.text: Get those fires out!
Did you think to take any extinguishers when you stole this ship?
Blast it... Outlander! You're up! See what you can do with this thing....
That's two more shuttles you owe me.
You didn't even own this one. It really shouldn't count.
It was mine when it crashed, it counts.
Do we know anything about this swamp?
What is this place?
I didn't realize we were being billed for this level of service.
You expect to be paid for this?
Quiet! There could be anything out here.
Keep it down!
It's just a little game we have.
You will be reimbursed.
Of course. Never doubted it.
Well, there's wild animals, angry exiles, ungrateful rescue-ees....
The point is a good one.
Fine, fine....
Anything on your sensors?
Confirmation: I've detected a large metallic object nearby. Analysis suggests a technological construct, but there are no energy readings.
Whatever it is, it's got better chances of flying than this thing. Engine's fried to a crisp.
Skytroopers won't be far behind us. We need to hide the evidence of our landing.
I'll scavenge, you bury?
Just like Arron Prime.
I get the sense you two have been working together for a while.
You two have some history, huh?
I want you to know that I appreciate all you've done. You obviously risked a lot to rescue me--thank you.
I need to thank you all.
We know they're coming--rig the shuttle to explode when they get close. They'll search more slowly once they're worried about traps.
Set a trap instead.
Long enough....
Not a bad thought--I'll see what I can do.
I know you have more questions than answers, but we should really keep moving. I promise, I'll tell you everything I can as soon as we're safe.
Enthusiasm: Shall we investigate the technological object? I believe I can guide us to its location.
Sounds like a plan.
Not much to it. Barely populated, some old ruins scattered around, the usual grumpy wildlife you'd expect. People call it the Endless Swamp.
It's an old name. People were more dramatic back then.
Endless?
Very well.
You're welcome.
Though of course, the rescue isn't quite over yet.
